title: Lead Developer - azeti IoT Platform
description:
Wir sind ein Berliner Internet of Things (IoT) Software Unternehmen. Unsere IoT Plattform ermöglicht es, einfach und schnell industrielle IoT Anwendungen umzusetzen. Bereits seit 2006 bieten wir Software „Made in Germany” für nationale und internationale Kunden an. Sowohl in Europa, Amerika als auch in China, sind unsere IoT-Lösungen im Einsatz. Als Spezialisten für Digitalisierung und IoT wird unsere TÜV-geprüfte IoT-Plattform bereits in verschiedensten Branchen eingesetzt. Diverse Forschungsprojekte und langjährige OEM-Partnerschaften in der Industrie unterstreichen unsere Kompetenz und Expertise zur Lösung anspruchsvollster IoT-Projekte. Mit unserer Open Source Edge Software und der brandneuen IoT Plattform gehen wir noch einen Schritt weiter und werden das Internet der Dinge für alle ermöglichen.

Weitere Informationen über uns unter [www.azeti.net](http://t3u1.mjt.lu/lnk/AMcAAEo_L1gAAAAAAAAAAG3sWXAAAAAA-nQAAAAAAAZPNgBgMA9zaKDBJUTkTSCTdbhAfs4ZZwAGCXo/2/YtLaNYO8H-VqgZJJuhLQ_w/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYXpldGkubmV0).

**Warum wir?**

Diese seltsamen Zeiten verlangen uns allen viel ab. **Wir bieten unserem Team ein sicheres und langfristiges Arbeitsumfeld und sind auf der Suche nach neuen Teammitgliedern, die unser Team für die nächsten Jahre ergänzen.** Neben einem sicheren Geschäftsmodell, sind wir als Tochterunternehmen der Aurubis AG ein sicherer Arbeitgeber für Deine berufliche Zukunft.

- **Stabiles und sicheres Arbeitsumfeld**
- Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Rücksichtnahme auf Ihre familiären Belange (Homeschooling, Kinderbetreuung, etc.)
- Home-Office möglich mit regelmäßigen Fahrten (alle 4-6 Wochen) zu Workshops und Veranstaltungen in unserem Berliner HQ
- Freie Wahl der Hardware (Linux, Mac, Windows) und Ausstattung für Ihr Home Office
- Überdurchschnittliches Gehalt und tolle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
- Agiles Arbeiten in einem vielfältigen internationalen Team, flache Hierarchien
- Direkter Einfluss auf die Produktentwicklung mit sofortiger Wirkung für unseren Kundenstamm
- Erstklassiger Technologie-Stack mit spannenden Entwicklungen, die bereits in Arbeit sind
- [Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft](http://t3u1.mjt.lu/lnk/AMcAAEo_L1gAAAAAAAAAAG3sWXAAAAAA-nQAAAAAAAZPNgBgMA9zaKDBJUTkTSCTdbhAfs4ZZwAGCXo/3/9DLcVbz8zz2GGtCENkt0Cw/aHR0cHM6Ly9jb3Jwb3JhdGUudXJiYW5zcG9ydHNjbHViLmNvbS9lbg), vollständig von uns bezahlt
- Fahrrad-Leasing per [Business-Bike](http://t3u1.mjt.lu/lnk/AMcAAEo_L1gAAAAAAAAAAG3sWXAAAAAA-nQAAAAAAAZPNgBgMA9zaKDBJUTkTSCTdbhAfs4ZZwAGCXo/4/DjTuSZj6OpRmb9pgcU_gTw/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYnVzaW5lc3NiaWtlLmRlL2Rl) oder [Jobrad](http://t3u1.mjt.lu/lnk/AMcAAEo_L1gAAAAAAAAAAG3sWXAAAAAA-nQAAAAAAAZPNgBgMA9zaKDBJUTkTSCTdbhAfs4ZZwAGCXo/5/NR-efXq3OpjFC0op9Xm3Zw/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuam9icmFkLm9yZy8)
- [Corporate Benefits Programm](http://t3u1.mjt.lu/lnk/AMcAAEo_L1gAAAAAAAAAAG3sWXAAAAAA-nQAAAAAAAZPNgBgMA9zaKDBJUTkTSCTdbhAfs4ZZwAGCXo/6/XZxKFG6MjbrMadGHOsKT6w/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY29ycG9yYXRlLWJlbmVmaXRzLmRlLw) mit tollen Rabatten
- Kontinuierliches Lernen und 100 € [Udemy](http://t3u1.mjt.lu/lnk/AMcAAEo_L1gAAAAAAAAAAG3sWXAAAAAA-nQAAAAAAAZPNgBgMA9zaKDBJUTkTSCTdbhAfs4ZZwAGCXo/7/9I9q3pGcJqvMGJKESM0zxw/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudWRlbXkuY29tLw)-Budget pro Monat

**Deine Aufgaben**

**Um unsere IoT Platform auf das nächste Level heben zu können, sucht unser IoT Platform Team (6 Entwickler) nach einem erfahrenen Lead der als aktiver Entwickler durch technische Finesse, Agilität und Erfahrung führt.** Gemeinsam mit dem Team entwickelst Du die Platform weiter und hast hierbei best practices und moderne Methoden im Fokus. Du inspirierst und spornst an durch Know-How und stellst den status quo in Frage. Hierbei wirst Du ca. 80% als Fullstack Entwickler arbeiten und 20% für Führungsaufgaben aufbringen, somit bist Du nah am Produkt und aktiver Teil der Entwicklung.
Du stellst dich mit dem Team den nächsten großen Herausforderungen (k8s, CI/CD, end-to-end Testing, Kafka uvm.) und hilfst durch agile Heransgehensweise auch schwierige Anforderungen gemeinschaftlich zu meistern.
Uns ist wichtig das Du als Team Lead auf Augenhöhe führst und durch deine Expertise und Erfahrung inspirierst und hier als Experte ein zentraler Teil des Teams bist.

**Des Weiteren umfasst deine Rolle:**

- Kommuniziere Best Practices und Qualitätsansprüche klar und kontinuierlich
- Pair Programming, Code Reviews sowie Supervision unserer Architektur und der Backlog gemeinsam mit Product Owner
- Thematische Organisation regelmäßiger Workshops und Trainings, bei der Logistik hilft dir unsere nette Team-Assistenz
- Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Scrum Master und Product Owner um sicherzustellen, dass das Team eng zusammenarbeiten kann und es keine Blocker gibt
- Teamkollegen anleiten, führen und inspirieren, um ein gesundes, hochkarätiges Entwicklungsteam zu schaffen
- Finde pragmatische und agile Lösungen, beginnen mit Rapid Prototyping und iteriere in Richtung MVP's mit konstanten Feedbackschleifen, Tests und Zusammenarbeit
- Hinterfrage Anforderungen und berate, um pragmatische Lösungen zu finden und stets einen Kundennutzen zu liefern
- Regelmäßige Kommunikation mit Stakeholdern und dem erweiterten Kollegium

**Place of Work**

Wir arbeiten derzeit komplett remote und glauben an flexible Arbeitsvereinbarungen. Du kannst die meiste Zeit aus dem Home-Office arbeiten. Unser Ziel ist es, das Team alle 4-6 Wochen in unserem Büro für Workshops und Veranstaltungen zu versammeln.

**Deine Rolle wird insbesondere Mentoring deiner Kollegen beinhalten, daher ist es von großem Vorteil, wenn Du nah an oder in Berlin wohnst.**

**Dein Profil**

- **Mindestens 2 Jahre praktische Erfahrung in der Führung eines agilen Software-Teams**
- Agiler Arbeitsansatz, der ständige Iteration und Zusammenarbeit beinhaltet
- Du sprichst fließend Englisch, **Deutsch Sprachkenntnisse sind ein großes Plus**
- Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, mündlich und schriftlich starke Präsentationsfähigkeiten
- Erfahrung in der Entwicklung in agilen Umgebungen (Scrum, Kanban)
- Hohes Maß an Eigenorganisation und aktive Kommunikation
- **Umfangreiche Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Microservices Applikation**
- **Umfangreiche Erfahrung mit Spring Framework in Java oder Kotlin**
- Erfahrung Umgang mit Functional Components ReactJS und TypeScript
- Erfahrung und Interesse an Datenvisualisierung und Dashboarding sind ein Plus
- Erfahrung in der Entwicklung Event getriebener Applikationen ist ein Plus
- Erfahrung mit Kafka ist ein Plus

**Wenn Du in der Nähe von Berlin lebst, ist das ein großes Plus.**

**Kontakt**

Bitte ]bewirb dich über unsere Karriereseite](http://t3u1.mjt.lu/lnk/AMcAAEo_L1gAAAAAAAAAAG3sWXAAAAAA-nQAAAAAAAZPNgBgMA9zaKDBJUTkTSCTdbhAfs4ZZwAGCXo/8/cIpHNaAls0r986HOZpNRIQ/aHR0cHM6Ly9hemV0aS5qb2JzLnBlcnNvbmlvLmRlLw) oder sende deine Unterlagen an career@azeti.net. Dein Ansprechpartner ist Sebastian Koch.

![GoHiring](https://t.gohiring.com/h/a6bbd71fa89a98e7758344dd6771758ae723722e9febd3066d152e24dcf1c39f)

title: SVP Engineering (m/f/x)
description:
**A bit about us**

At CLARK we believe that the significant things in life should be simple. With this vision in mind, we have set out to create an application which makes it easier, simpler, and faster for consumers to manage their insurances - all in one central place where changes can be done with just a few clicks. Our secret sauce is to combine a best-in-industry user experience with honest and independent advice from insurance experts.

Since our founding in 2015, we have served over 300,000 satisfied customers. We are extremely proud of more than 250 employees from over 40 nations, working from our offices in Berlin, Frankfurt, Vienna and Püttlingen. We were recognized by the German tech magazine Gründerszene as the fastest growing technology company in Germany for 2019. We want your help to get us to the next level.

**What is this about?**

We are looking for an experienced professional to lead the engineering and technology part of our organisation, directly reporting to the CPTO

**Your Responsibilities**

- Functioning as an integral part of our leadership team you develop a clear technology vision for our product and co-shape the strategy, positioning and leadership culture of the organisation.
- Creating a healthy culture of collaboration and inclusion through leading by example in line with the engineering and company values where people can fulfill their potential and bring value to our customers.
- Developing and overseeing the engineering capabilities, including technical strategy, architectural evolution, information security, cloud operations and office it, so we become the largest insurance broker in Europe.
- Advocating and advancing state of the art agile software development practices and help develop and evangelize great engineering and collaboration practices.
- Providing expert mentorship and exemplary behaviour for your teams and direct reports in order to drive engineering quality and excellence while also building up a vibrant and productive engineering culture
- Applying pragmatic solutions, find the right tradeoffs and reduce complexity to help teams deliver and increase impact on our customers
- Financial planning and management

**What you have:**

- 10+ years of tech people management experience, and 5 years working as an engineering manager or an engineer
- Demonstrated capability to inspire and motivate engineering teams
- 10+ years of software and product development experience across various domains
- Understanding of modern software architecture
- Customer and quality focus with a bias for action
- Strong business acumen and high work ethics with the ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast paced environment
- Very strong English communication skills. German skills would be a great plus
- Background in B2C and financial industry would perfectly round off your profile

**Why CLARK:**

Everyone offers perks like free coffee, free drinks, flat hierarchies. We offer you all that but more in the shape of:

- A multicultural environment with international colleagues.
- Subsidised job ticket and a company pension.
- A lot of freedom: You want to pursue further education? An MBA was always a dream of yours? We offer you support for your education while working with us.
- Support for relocation - and we don't mean only a work permit. The process of getting you here and the costs associated with it are all supported.
- Fear of not speaking the language? We offer beginner and advanced German and English classes in house.
- Want to inspire and share knowledge? We have you covered with our weekly Tech Brown Bag speech.
- And last but not least: Sure, we know how to celebrate success! We offer you quarterly company events, monthly team lunch & breakfast as well as our weekly Friday get together.

**Sounds exciting? We agree, and we cannot wait to have your application!**

**CLARK is an equal opportunity employer.**

We're all about equal opportunity and committed to inclusion across gender, age, race, religion, identity and experience!

title: Tech Lead -(Remote-US)
description:
Join the fast growing company that is changing the way drug therapies are managed. Help curb the fastest rising spend problem of the US Healthcare system. VIVIO Health is on a mission to help make data the basis for clinical decision making. VIVIO’s evidence-based, data-driven specialty drug management and cost control solution has improved healthcare outcomes and lowered costs for large self-insured employers since 2016. We’re also an unusual company by today’s standards as we are profitable, fast growing and haven’t had to raise any external capital.

We're looking for a talented and mission-aligned Tech Lead/Sr. DevOps engineer with significant cloud architectural experience and proficiency in information security to join our team in a key technical leadership role reporting to the CEO.

We’re seeking a self-starter who is excited to work with a dynamic group of individuals who respect one another, value empathetic leadership, lead by example, work collaboratively, and are wildly passionate about our shared goals.

Job Description
-

__About You:__

You know that Life is short and you want to make a difference!

As an effective Platform Technical Lead you will be detail oriented, have broad technical understanding, and be a team performer. You have a diverse background in architecture, distributed systems, and development. To be successful, you must have extensive experience working with cloud technologies, be able to solve complex problems quickly, and thrive in a highly collaborative environment. You will have > 5 years of experience successfully developing, deploying and managing applications in a cloud environment.

Micromanagement is not our style. We are only interested in team members that are reliable and committed. If you are a problem solver, enjoy thinking creatively about new challenges, and are looking for the next challenge, you would love being on this team.

What You'll Be Doing
-

- Design, build, maintain, and modify infrastructure for scaled applications within AWS Virtual Private Cloud (VPCs).
- Produce high-quality software that is well-designed, maintainable, unit tested, code reviewed and checked regularly for continuous integration
- Work closely with a small, distributed, dynamic, Engineering Team to make sure all systems remain HIPAA and SOC2 compliant
- Assist in the architecture, engineering, development, and quality assurance of data-producing/consuming software.
- Automate software builds and deployments on Linux servers.
- Operate within Windows (Active Directory) and Linux environments.
- Support distributed web applications in a complex, and evolving environment.
- Work throughout the application and infrastructure project: including design, architecture, communication, monitoring, availability, scaling, failover and recover

Qualification
-

__We're Looking For Somebody Who Has__
- 5+ years building and running applications, specifically around third party integrations and data processing in an AWS environment.
- 5+ years experience with Python (PHP is a +)
- Experience with relational databases such as MySQL
- Experience working with restful APIs, micro-services, & Atlassian toolset
- Expert hands on experience with AWS cloud technologies.
- Extreme attention to detail
- Familiarity with compliance & security standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST
- 3-5 Years of Linux systems administration, preferably Ubuntu
- 3-5 Years Microsoft Windows Systems management experience desired
- Ability to work on features independently
- BS or advanced degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

Additional Information
-

VIVIO Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of any status or condition protected by applicable Federal, state or local municipal law. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

__Regular Full-time position (direct hire)__

__Remote Role__

title: Senior Fullstack Developer (m/f/d)
description:
Senior Fullstack Developer (m/f/d) 
Full-time in 01099 Dresden (Remote Option)

E-mobility is the future ... and it has already started!	

Become part of chargeIT mobility who is part of Eneco eMobility - one of the leading providers of intelligent charging systems and solutions in the EV market that has built up a strong position in the Netherlands, Belgium and Germany. There is only one way to realize our current phase of international expansion: growing towards a digital company with scalable and smart IT solutions. 

That's why we'd love to welcome you on board so we can focus on enterprise platforms, user interfaces and user experience together. Your tasks will be in the area of headless CMS development, design and development of backend and frontend components and applications for web & mobile.

Ideally, you should already have experience in the field of eMobility. Fundamentally, you should be well-versed in headless CMS systems, GraphQL and modern frameworks for mobile and web applications, as well as enjoy implementing software from business concept to scalable product used by thousands of users. If so, you'll play a critical role in building scalable applications that delight our customers and teaching our way of working, which is based on the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).

These are your tasks
- As a Senior Fullstack Developer (m/f/d) you are responsible for design, development and testing of applications and services.
- You work on the design as well as the implementation of a customer journey with inspiring UX and create SEO-friendly content & products.
- You are quality oriented and willing to take responsibility for the working solution.
- Develop according to clean code principles, integrate automated tests and build pipelines.

This distinguishes you
- At least 4 years of experience with various frameworks and libraries for API development and connectivity, in the UI space with React or Vue.js, and with various database systems
- Experience with headless CMS and static site generation is a plus
- Ability to develop software in an agile scrum process and willingness to work with remote teams
- Self-starter and motivated to make an individual contribution
- Fluency in English or German

Benefits
- Company pension plan & occupational disability insurance
- (e-)Bike leasing
- Individual training budget
- Mobile working: in the office, at home and on the road
- Flexible working hours and vacation
- Flat hierarchies

Interested?

description:

Consors Finanz ist Teil der BNP Paribas S.A. in Deutschland und hat ca. 1500 Mitarbeitende an fünf Standorten. BNP Paribas S.A. ist eine führende internationale Bank und in 73 Ländern mit 200.000 Mitarbeitenden vertreten.

description:
LOOKING FOR LOCAL PHP DEVELOPER IN THE KNOXVILLE/MARYVILLE, TENNESSEE AREA.
We are a title management company based in Maryville, TN.  We service over 41 states across the U.S. and are looking for someone with an upbeat professional attitude who's eager to hang with us.  It's an exciting and fun place to work where you can learn, earn, and grow with us! This position is NOT a remote position. Please do NOT apply if you cannot work at our offices in Maryville, Tennessee.

PHP DEVELOPER
Qualified, self-driven developer responsible for maintaining, updating, and upgrading client and server-side HTML /CSS /JS, PHP & Node Systems.
Responsibilities include setting deadlines, performing or automating regular maintenance tasks, performing system account updates, and optimizing existing systems in both PHP 5.6 and 7.2.
Pay is relevant to work experience and knowledge base.

General Requirements
Experienced in Large or Scalable Web Development
Seasoned in PHP
Work Well in a fast-paced environment
Must be able to use high-level logic & reasoning
Must have excellent communication skill
Must be able to plan and set deadlines effectively
Must be willing to learn, and keep up to date knowledge on web development practices
Knowledgeable in Standard HTML, CSS & JS
Knowledgeable in Objective, Functional, & Procedural Programing & Methodologies
AWS Experience (including but not limited to EC2, Route 53,  EBS operational & maintenance experience)
MySQL General Experience
Docker & Containerization knowledge, and experience.
5 + years general programing experience
2 + years of Object-Oriented programing experience
Language/ Framework /Library Requirements:
PHP 5.6
PHP 7.3
NodeJS (JavaScript)
MySQL
Composer (PHP)
NPM (NodeJS)
jQuery (JavaScript)
Bootstrap (HTML, CSS)
Recommended Frameworks/Libraries
Laravel (PHP)
React (NodeJS)
Environment Familiarity (Required)
Docker
AWS EC2
Linux

We provide a nice friendly environment with professional people.
We hire for life.
Some staffers have been with us since our conception 13 years ago. Our employees arrive to work happy and leave happy and we like that a lot.
The dress code is casual.
You will receive vacation pay, major holiday pay, PTO, and bonuses.

Hours are 8-5 Monday-Friday, with evenings and weekends off.
Send us your resume and tell us a little about yourself, and we'll contact you with further details about our company and how to schedule an interview.

title: Backend-Entwickler (w/m/x)
description:
BITGRIP ist Berater, Entwickler, Designer und Integrator für digitale Lösungen. Wir verwandeln Bits mit Herz und Grips in ein Lächeln. Auf Basis von über 500 Jahren geballter IT-Projekterfahrung helfen wir Kunden in jedem Bereich der digitalen Wertschöpfung.

**Aufgaben**

*Du passt zu uns, wenn du ...*

- Java und Java EE Applications sicher analysierst, designst und implementieren kannst
- unsere Lösungen im Bereich Enterprise Content Management entwickelst und verbesserst
- ein ambitionierter Coder bist, der für sein Fachgebiet brennt, egal ob du Autodidakt, graduiert oder Professional bist
- sicher auf Deutsch kommunizieren kannst, Englisch ist bei uns ein Plus
- Du hast bestenfalls Erfahrung mit CoreMedia, GraphCMS oder anderen Java-CMS

*Wir passen zu dir, weil wir ...*

- bewusst auf branchenübliches Project-Hopping verzichten und dir neben spannender Projekte eine familienfreundliche Arbeitsweise garantieren
- ein (r)evolutionäres Unternehmen sind, beinahe ohne Hierarchien – bei uns gibt es keine Abteilungen, - keine Angst und (fast) keine Überstunden, weil wir auf Selbstverantwortung, Freiheit, Spaß und Feedback setzen
- dir einen tollen Tech Stack und ein erfahrenes Team bieten, um gemeinsam zu wachsen und großartiges zusammen zu erreichen

**Qualifikation**

*Das ist deine Toolbox:*

- OOP, REST, AOP
- Java
- Python, Groovy, Shell
- Spring, Hibernate, JUnit, Mockito
- Kubernetes, Docker, Helm
- Git

**Benefits**

- einen leistungsfähigen Tech Stack
- Flache Hierarchien, Eigenverantwortung, Spaß
- Kein Dresscode
- Auswahl deiner Hard- & Software
- flexible Arbeitszeiten & Homeoffice für alle
- einen unbefristeten Voll- oder Teilzeitvertrag mit attraktiver Vergütung und ganz wichtig: bei uns werden Überstunden vermieden und in Freizeit umgewandelt
- zertifizierte Schulungsangebote
- 6 Wochen Urlaub
- BAV
- Jobrad / Bahnticket

Klingt gut soweit? Dann bewird dich direkt oder melde dich via E-Mail, Twitter oder LinkedIn bei uns inklusive deines frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins und deiner Gehaltsvorstellungen und wir bringen dich mit deinem neuen Team in Kontakt – unkompliziert und ohne zig Gesprächsrunden.

Come and join the #besteamintown.

title: Python Web Developer
description:
At Premiere, we are working with a large dataset to build software solutions for order tracking, global pricing management, targeted marketing, and sales analytics. 

We’re looking for a web developer experienced with Python and interested in learning new technologies to join our team. You’ll work with our remote team to build great products that delight the people using them. 

### Who you are...
* You’re a critical thinker. You’re able to be highly effective with very few directions. 
* You have excellent communication skills and the ability to convey your ideas clearly and concisely.
* You are super smart and have either a degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.
* You have the space, equipment, bandwidth, and personal commitment required to be highly productive while working from home.

### You’re great at... 
* Collaborating with engineers and product managers to build web app components 
* Applying appropriate software design patterns for a given problem 
* Reading and understanding code whether you or someone else wrote it 
* Delivering quality code using Python for backend applications (Flask/Django) 
* Working with both relational and NoSQL databases (MySQL/Postgres/Cassandra/Elasticsearch/Redis) 
* JavaScript and UI development (jQuery/Bootstrap)
* Maintaining automated tests and ensuring quality in your code 
* Using Git to manage multiple branches and fix merge conflicts 

Bonus points if you have open source contributions or personal projects you’ve shipped successfully.
how_to_apply: Please send resume and cover letter to reid@premieredigital.net

title: Senior Frontend Engineer*
description:
Evernest is a Proptech startup from Hamburg backed by top investors. We are redefining how homes are bought and sold in metropolitan areas. To do so, we combine start-up culture with years of extensive industry experience. We are convinced that agents, sellers and buyers deserve a better service and more support. That is why we are bringing together the world’s top minds in technology, data and real estate. We offer agents and their clients a platform for a previously unseen and seamless real estate experience. 


**Responsibilities**
- Building a top-notch and intuitive front-end for our platform that empowers real estate agents, buyers and sellers
- Building a mobile application that empowers real estate agents
- Evaluating visual designs from a technical perspective
- Being part of our agile, smart and open-minded team
- Getting better every day by taking on challenging tasks
 

**Qualifications**
- Solid understanding of and experience with React.js (> 3 years)
- Profound knowledge of TypeScript/ESnext and its ecosystem (> 3 years), ideally also of other programming languages
- Experience with CSS-in-JS technologies (preferred Emotion.js or Styled Components)
- Understanding the importance of A11y and how to implement it in custom components
- Mobile first layouts and responsive websites
- Solid understanding of and experience with React Native
- Semantic HTML and the value of SEO
- DevOps mindset: operating and maintaining our software is a collective responsibility
- Passion to share knowledge and strive to learn from others
- Constant drive for improving processes and thinking in long-term wins
- Good communication skills 
- Fluency in English, written and verbal; German is a plus

**Current Tech Stack**
- Docker, GCloud, Kubernetes
- PostgreSQL
- Python, Django, Django REST Framework
- ES6, React, Typescript, Node.js
- Contentful CMS
- Storybook
- Emotion.js
- Next.js
- GraphQL
 

**Benefits**
- Permanent position with above average compensation package
- 27 days of paid vacation
- Productivity equipment (laptop, mobile phone)
- Homeoffice
- Challenging position in a fast-paced environment
 

Your mindset is what matters to us - your age, your sex or your origin makes no difference 
at Evernest. It’s important that you fit into our team.


Sounds good? Just submit your resume!
talents@evernest.com

title: Backend Developer (m/f/x)
description:
German Bionic, headquartered in Augsburg with bases in Berlin and Tokyo, is the first German company that develops, builds and markets smart exoskeletons with connected IoT platform services for industrial use and logistics workplaces. German Bionic Cray X was specially designed for people manually handling goods and tools, to reduce compression pressure in the lower back area. Linking robust hardware with the latest cloud and IoT technologies, the German Bionic IO platform is the gateway to highest performance solutions and true integration in enterprise systems. We are looking for talents who want to join us to create the tools for the future.

Our products and services are not only unique, they are also multi-award winners. German Bionic has been awarded the prestigious German Founders Award 2019. Previously, the company and its product Cray X have already won numerous awards, including the Bavarian Founders Award 2019, the Land of the Ideas Award 2018 in the category Human and Machine and the MM Award Automatica 2018.

[Learn more...](http://t3u1.mjt.lu/lnk/AVIAACMeRtAAAAAAAAAAAG3sWXAAAAAA-nQAAAAAAAZPNgBgLoq5nyuHrHtNQ5CxBDGQhuUxxQAGCXo/2/RhTPjK4FUktcPmN2CieRnw/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ2VybWFuYmlvbmljLmNvbS9lbi9hYm91dC8)

**Exoskeletons - Made in Germany**

Starting at the earliest possible date, German Bionic Systems is looking for an experienced, driven **Backend Developer** at our Augsburg or Potsdam locations.

**About the role**

As our Backend Developer, you will be part of our cross-functional, agile development team that is responsible for building and maintaining our web based Cloud Platform German Bionic IO. You will work with the latest technologies and have a keen eye on all aspects that contribute to a solid implementation.

**Tasks and responsibilities**

As a backend developer (m / f / x) you will take on a responsible role in our cross-functional and agile development team, whose focus is on setting up and optimizing our web-based cloud platform German Bionic IO with corresponding IT applications for the users of our Cray X exoskeleton stands. You work with the most modern technologies and focus on all aspects that are required for an intelligent and stable implementation.

**Requirements for the role**

- Experience with microservices and an appreciation for architecture best practices
- Work experience or strong background knowledge as a DevOps Engineer is a strong plus
- Proficiency with Golang, ideally showcasing own Go projects
- Experience in the latest cloud technologies (e.g. Docker, docker-compose, configuration management tools)
- Experience with AWS, Azure or comparable cloud services.
- Familiarity with database technologies such as Postgres, TICK stack, MongoDB
- You are passionate about your software craftsmanship, you have a ton of curiosity and you enjoy learning with and from others
- You have enthusiasm for agile methods and DevOps practices
- You have excellent spoken and written English skills, German is not mandatory

**What we offer**

- Exciting insights into an innovative product and a future-orientied business
- A varied enviroment at the first German exoskeleton manufacturer
- Attractive salary and social corporate benefits
- Flexible working hours and working arrangements
- Extensive onboarding and numerous learning opportunities
- Career options and prospects in a modern and growing company

**Are you interested?**

We are looking forward to your application, including your CV, a motivational letter and relevant certificates, to the attention of Mr. Jonathan Silverman | Human Resources.

You can send your application either via [email](mailto:german-bionic-jobs@m.personio.de) or by using the [application form on our website](http://t3u1.mjt.lu/lnk/AVIAACMeRtAAAAAAAAAAAG3sWXAAAAAA-nQAAAAAAAZPNgBgLoq5nyuHrHtNQ5CxBDGQhuUxxQAGCXo/3/8EiXc7uaTIy4gtYVfV11Pg/aHR0cHM6Ly9nZXJtYW4tYmlvbmljLWpvYnMucGVyc29uaW8uZGUvam9iLzE4NDQ4Mz9sYW5ndWFnZT1lbiNhcHBseQ#apply).

![GoHiring](https://t.gohiring.com/h/af53da17dd19b84594053c8e6a68c77949205a093c5a3e2192d438897916eb89)

title: Java Software Developer (m/w/d)
description:
Wir sind ein europaweit tätiges Familienunternehmen, das Warehouse-Management-Systeme plant und realisiert. TUP ist auf hochwertige Softwarelösungen der Intralogistik spezialisiert; neben dem Routen des Materialflusses innerhalb von Distributionszentren entwickelt TUP individuelle Lösungen für nahezu alle Aspekte des täglichen Betriebs eines Distributionszentrums.

Als Software Manufaktur gehen wir neue Wege und bieten unseren Kunden eine ganzheitliche Unterstützung auf ihrem Weg der Logistik. Dafür beraten wir und erschaff en individuelle Softwarelösungen und erhöhen somit die Flexibilität und Wettbewerbsfähigkeit unserer Projektpartner.

Sie sind mit Entwicklungsprinzipien wie Clean Architecture bestens vertraut und arbeiten gerne an der Schnittstelle zwischen Industrie und Software?  Dann erwartet Sie bei TUP ein professionelles und menschliches Arbeitsumfeld mit flachen Hierarchien und offener Kommunikation. Neben der Option auf einen Firmen-PKW und der Teilnahme am betrieblichen Gesundheitsmanagement bieten wir Raum für selbstorganisierte Gruppen für Tischtennis, Boule, Fußball sowie Klettern, Kochen, Schach oder Laufen– regelmäßige Grillsessions vom Chef persönlich, interne Weinproben, unternehmerische Betriebsausflüge und Feste runden die einzigartige TUP-Gemeinschaft ab. 

Ihr Verantwortungsbereich:
* Entwicklung und Pflege des Warehouse-Management-Systems von TUP
* Spannende und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben im gesamten Software-Entwicklungsprozess – von der individuellen Anforderungsanalyse, über die Konzeption, bis hin zur Umsetzung und Integration beim Kunden
* Entwicklung individueller, auf den Kunden zugeschnittene Softwaremodule
* Projektübergreifender Einsatz auf Basis der gesammelten Kompetenz möglich und erwünscht
* Eigene, verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben mit Gestaltungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten

Ihre Kompetenzen:
* Abgeschlossenes Bachelor- oder Masterstudium im Bereich der Informatik, Medien- oder Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eines anderen informatikorientierten Studiengangs
* Praktische Erfahrungen und fundierte Kenntnisse in der Java-Softwareentwicklung sowie im Umgang mit Datenbanken (Oracle, SQL)
* Keine Berührungsangst vor komplexen industriellen Prozessabläufen
* Aufgeschlossen für neue Technologien rund um die Softwareentwicklung
* Teamfähigkeit innerhalb von kleinen Teams setzen wir voraus
* Hohes Verantwortungsbewusstsein, strategisches Denken und gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten runden ihr persönliches Profil ab

Das Familienunternehmen DR. THOMAS + PARTNER GmbH & Co. KG (TUP) baut mit rund 40 Jahren Erfahrung auf eine grundsätzlich solide Basis, um seine Innovationen in den Segmenten Intralogistik und Materialfluss voranzutreiben und fortlaufend weiterzuentwickeln.
Ein Team von über 130 Spezialisten bildet das Rückgrat der Firma, zudem ist der Drang nach Optimierung und neuen Herausforderungen der Antrieb der Software-Manufaktur. TUP ist ein zuverlässiger Partner bei konzeptionellen Fragen, kleinen wie großen Projekten, der Modellierung von Software sowie bei der Auswahl passender Technologien.

Im Verlauf der letzten Jahrzehnte ist der Name DR. THOMAS + PARTNER zum Inbegriff maßgeschneiderter Intralogistiklösungen geworden. Namhafte Kunden wie adidas, Canyon, Bosch, Otto oder Zalando unterstreichen die Präsenz am Markt. Diese technologische Spitzenposition verdankt das Unternehmen seinen erstklassigen Beschäftigten.
Weitere Informationen unter: www.tup.com
how_to_apply: Senden Sie Ihre Unterlagen einfach career@tupc.om oder besuchen Sie unsere Karriere-Seite: https://www.tup.com/intralogistik-loesungen/karriere-bei-tup/
